data.approach: Research all Beads features used by SQUAD: CLI commands, JSONL storage, dependency tracking, IDE integration, git sync. Compare against what a simple SQLite tasks table would provide.

summary: Catalogued all Beads features used by SQUAD
Identified what a simple SQLite table would/would not cover
Assessed JSONL git-sync model vs alternatives
findings: SQUAD uses ~15% of Beads features: CRUD, deps, ready query, labels
JSONL is the git-sync mechanism - 2MB file with 1735 events
32MB Go binary for something achievable with ~500 lines of bash/JS
IDE already reads SQLite directly (lib/beads.js), only writes via bd CLI
recommendedActions: Review the analysis and decide whether to proceed with replacement

summary: Catalogued all Beads features SQUAD uses (~10 commands out of 40+, 12 columns out of 50+)
Created detailed replacement plan (lib/tasks.js + jt CLI + .squad/ directory)
Created epic squad-n8xkf with 7 child tasks and dependency chain
findings: 32MB Go binary replaceable with ~700 lines of JS+bash
IDE already reads SQLite directly - just need to add writes

summary: Investigated Beads CLI capabilities and potential advantages over SQLite task tables
Documented specific features and unique benefits of Beads
Prepared initial research to determine if Beads offers additional workflow improvements

suggestedTasks.title: Create Comprehensive Beads vs SQLite Task Management Comparison
suggestedTasks.description: Develop a detailed documentation comparing Beads and SQLite task tracking capabilities. Include specific feature matrix, pros and cons, and recommended use cases for each. Focus on CLI functionality, task management workflow, and integration potential with current development processes.
suggestedTasks.reason: Need clear understanding of Beads' unique value proposition

suggestedTasks.title: Prototype Beads CLI Workflow Integration
suggestedTasks.description: Create a small proof-of-concept project demonstrating Beads CLI integration with existing task management workflow. Highlight specific CLI commands, interaction patterns, and potential productivity gains compared to current SQLite approach.
suggestedTasks.reason: Validate potential improvements in task tracking methodology

patterns: Evaluate tool capabilities before full integration
